result.execSummary:
The defendant William A Watson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must have no contact with Lisa D. or Larry C..
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.

Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

Per C-31.
Must make minimum monthly payments of $200.00 per month beginning February 1, 2015.
